title: Market Extra: Is the stock market open? Here are the market hours on New Year's Eve and Day
text: Wall Street on Thursday is looking forward to a farewell to a pandemic-stricken year in the last trading day in 2020.

title: The Market Floats In A Sea Of Mines
text: A Covid-19 torpedo ripped into the side of our ship and did tremendous damage. The pandemic was a true 'Black Swan' event. It turned out that there were some automatic compartment doors that immediately closed to wall off the damage (stimulus and Fed policy).

title: Most Sector Charts Are Consolidating At Year-End (Technically Speaking For 12/30)
text: Two new vaccines have been approved; one in Britain, the other in China. Most projections for Q4 growth are weaker.

title: Epicenter stocks and bitcoin will surge in 2021, market bull Tom Lee predicts
text: Tom Lee, Fundstrat managing partner and the head of research, joins CNBC's "Fast Money" to break down his market outlook for 2021.

title: Small caps' breakout is just starting, $17 billion money manager predicts
text: Bryn Mawr's Jeff Mills sees small caps outperforming large-cap stocks in 2021.

title: These 5 principles will influence 2021 markets, economy: UBS portfolio manager
text: UBS Wealth Management USA Senior Portfolio Manager Alan Rechtschaffen advises investors to look out for ‘positivity, POTUS, Powell, pathogens and preparation' in next year's markets. #FoxBusiness Subscribe to Fox Business!

title: The economy will be 'booming' in 2021 when Covid pandemic ends, says Hennessy Funds David Ellison
text: David Ellison, Hennessy Funds portfolio manager, joins CNBC's "Closing Bell" to discuss his outlook on

title: Reuters' Rob Cox lays out his top predications to watch in 2021
text: Rob Cox, Reuters Breakingviews global editor, breaks down his top predictions and trends for 2021.

title: U.S. futures little changed ahead of final day of 2020
text: Futures tied to the major U.S. indexes were mostly flat on Wednesday night.

title: Investors Hate Housing REITs, Love Housing
text: Investors have shown a disconnect between their belief in physical housing assets and in housing REITs. The performance of the two is strongly correlated over longer time periods, adjusted for leverage.

title: Markets Close Higher on Penultimate Trading Day of 2020
text: U.S. equity markets closed higher on the penultimate trading day of the year.

title: Dow Jones Industrial Average Hits Record High as 2020 Nears an End
text: And just like that, there was just one trading day left in 2020.

title: 3 Catalysts That Could Drive Stock Prices Higher In 2021
text: The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (NYSE: SPY) is on track to finish 2020 up about 15.5% on the year. But with the global pandemic still raging and stock valuations at historically high levels, investors are understandably concerned about whether the market rally will continue in 2021.

title: Global X 2021 Outlook
text: By Global X In 2020, annual outlooks quickly became obsolete as the COVID-19 pandemic caught the world by surprise. Nearly a year later, we believe massive stimulus efforts, vaccine development and distribution, and new political agendas put us on a likely more predictable path to recovery.

title: Tusk Ventures CEO Bradley Tusk on the red-hot IPO boom of 2020
text: Bradley Tusk, Tusk Ventures CEO, joins CNBC's "Closing Bell" to discuss the IPO boom in 2020 and whether the excitement over public offerings will extend into 2021.

title: Tech sector in 2021: Here's what to expect
text: Leigh Drogen, Estimize CEO, joins Yahoo Finance Live to discuss his outlook for tech in 2021 and which companies will keep up the momentum they saw in 2020. title: Earnings, Employment Data Headline First Week of 2021
text: The first week of 2021 will be packed full of economic indicators for investors to digest.

title: Stocks rise slightly on Wednesday amid renewed Covid-19 vaccine optimism
text: Robert Nobles, Synovus CIO, and Josh Brown, Ritholtz Wealth Management CEO, join CNBC's "Closing Bell" to break down Wednesday's market action. For access to live and exclusive video from CNBC subscribe to CNBC PRO: https://cnb.cx/2NGeIvi Stocks rose slightly on Wednesday amid renewed vaccine optimism while traders looked for clues on additional fiscal stimulus.

title: Market Extra: Wall Street pioneer says for first time clients are net short stocks on his platform
text: Thomas Peterffy's clients are net short the market. In other words, they are holding positions that collective imply that investors are wagering that stock values will fall eventually.

title: Stock Market Today: Dow Nicks New High in 2020's Penultimate Session
text: A Wednesday session light on trading volume and news alike ended in slight gains, with the Dow setting another fresh closing high.

title: The 4 Big Coincident Indicators As Of The End Of 2020
text: All of the important economic data for 2020 has already been released. The 4 most important components in the NBER's toolkit for calling recessions and expansions are real sales, real income, production, and employment.

title: Sizzling hot: Solar stocks set to end pandemic year at record highs
text: Solar stocks dazzled in 2020 and looked set to wrap up a year ravaged by the COVID-19 pandemic with triple-digit gains amid a shift in focus to 'clean energy' as the outbreak decimated the global oil industry.

title: US stocks end higher as $600 stimulus checks set to arrive this week
text: US stocks gained on Wednesday as $600 stimulus checks were set to be deposited into millions of Americans bank accounts later this week, according to Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin.  The stimulus checks could be increased if the Senate takes up the vote and passes a measure from the House that would increase the size of the payments to $2,000.

title: Dow ends at record high as investors focus on vaccine roll-out
text: U.S. equity markets booked modest gains on Wednesday, with investors buying energy and materials stocks in the second-to-last day of 2020 for Wall Street. The modest gains were sufficient to help the Dow Jones Industrial Average rise 0.2%, or about 73 points, to a new closing record at around 30,410 (based on preliminary levels], while the S&P 500 gained 0.1% to reach 3,732 and the Nasdaq Composite Index added 0.2% to close at 12,870.

title: No “realistic path” for vote by Senate on bigger stimulus checks, McConnell says
text: Prospects for larger direct payments to Americans from Washington dimmed Wednesday, as Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said he will not allow a standalone vote on the proposal approved by House Democrats on Monday.

title: These are the top 10 questions investors should be asking for 2021, according to Goldman Sachs
text: Heightened economic uncertainty, a continued surge in COVID-19 daily cases, and an incoming Biden administration are just a few factors investors will have to navigate in 2021. With those uncertainties in mind, Goldman Sachs listed the top ten questions investors should be asking in 2021 and its expectations, according to a note published on Monday.

title: Hard to see the market having a big correction in the short term, says Franklin Templeton's Dover
text: Stephen Dover, Franklin Templeton head of equities, and Ryan Detrick, LPL Financial chief market strategist, join 'Power Lunch' to discuss if there is a reason to pause on investing in the market right now and opportunities they're seeing in the market.

title: Housing 2021: An economist breaks down the latest trends
text: Calvin Schnure, Nareit's Senior Economist, joins Yahoo Finance's Seana Smith to discuss the real estate market, housing outlook, as well as break down his thoughts on the market and the impact the stimulus deal could have on it. title: Tilson: Frothy Stock Market Could Still Be 'One To Two Years From The Top'
text: A growing number of investors and analysts are becoming concerned about the stock market's steep valuations and the frothy trading in a number of tech stocks. Just because the market has a stretched valuation doesn't mean it can't go higher — and it doesn't mean the rally is nearing an end.

title: Economic Report: Resurgence in coronavirus-induced layoffs to keep U.S. jobless claims high
text: No matter whether U.S. jobless claims rise or fall in the last full week of December, one thing is clear: The coronavirus has punched another hole in the labor market.

title: 7 big investing lessons from 2020
text: Yahoo Finance's Ethan Wolff-Mann joins Kristin Myers to discuss the top mistakes investors have made this year and the investing lessons to take away from 2020. title: Why have stocks gone up so much in 2020?
text: Through Tuesday's close, the S&P 500 is up 15% this year and more than 60% from the March 23 lows, while the Nasdaq has gained 42% since January 1 and more than 85% since March 23. Julie Hyman, Brian Sozzi and Myles Udland discuss what's behind the market rally.

title: Stimulus ‘going to benefit' stock market in early 2021
text: Eva Ados, ERShares COO, joins Yahoo Finance's Kristin Myers to discuss the latest on the stimulus coming out of Washington, D.C., and what impact it will be having on the markets.

title: The Lesson Of 2020: Don't Bother With Predictions For 2021
text: Perhaps the best lesson we can take from 2020 is that we don't know what will happen in 2021.

title: The Stock Market Wasn't as Strong as It Looked in 2020. Here's What's Next for the New Year.
text: about the surprising reasons the market was up in 2020, why inflation isn't a worry, and how to maneuver your portfolio in 2021.

title: Dow rises more than 150 points as market tries to reclaim record highs
text: CNBC's "Halftime" traders break down Wednesday's market action as stocks attempt to reclaim record highs.

title: Stock market at all-time highs is stunning to AdvisorShares CEO
text: Noah Hamman, AdvisorShares Investments Founder and CEO joins the Yahoo Finance Live panel to discuss the latest market action. title: The Long Strange Trip Of The Muni Market In 2020
text: The bond fund outflows of March followed the downdraft in oil prices caused by the onset of the pandemic, which caused the sharp sell-off in the stock market. The rebound at the end of March was one of the most vigorous muni rallies ever witnessed.

title: $2,000 stimulus checks stall in the Senate as Treasury starts to send $600 payments
text: The Senate has no immediate plans to vote on a House-passed bill to increase the coronavirus relief stimulus checks to $2,000.

title: In One Chart: This chart shows how U.S. corporate debt ratings are set for a comeback next year
text: The gloom surrounding the health and indebtedness of U.S. corporations, resulting from the coronavirus pandemic's hit to the economy, is set to reverse next year if credit ratings agencies prove correct.

title: WBA Earnings, Employment Data Headline First Week of 2021
text: The first week of 2021 will be packed full of economic indicators for investors to digest.

title: Inflation Expectations Solidly On The Rise
text: Inflation expectations appear to be solidly on the rise and that spells big problems for the financial system. It is important to remember the cost of all commodities, goods, and services do not move and the same rate or even necessarily in the same direction.

title: Ritholtz on Hedge Fund Managers Versus Quants, Indexed Assets
text: Dec.30 -- Barry Ritholtz, founder of Ritholtz Wealth Management and a Bloomberg Opinion columnist, discusses the performance of human-run hedge funds compared to quants and his views on indexed assets. He speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance.

title: Markets Pricing-In Post-Pandemic Era
text: Two more full trading days for 2020 mean we could push our overall market levels higher, as we price in the post-pandemic era.

title: Fed's low interest rates will ‘cover over problems' for markets in 2021
text: Tim Courtney Exencial Wealth Advisors CIO joins Yahoo Finance Live to break down why markets are poised to bounce back in 2021.

title: How the pandemic drove massive stock market gains, and what happens next
text: The pandemic turned 2020 into a year of unprecedented events - not the least of which was the swift crash and then record-fast recovery of the stock market.

title: Looking Back At A Crazy, Stressful, Profitable Year
text: What a year. Here are some highlights as written while they happened here, along with a little bit of updated commentary about each post. So many penny stocks and/or low-margin business stocks and/or outright fraudulent company stocks are still up huge, though it looks like many have now cracked.

title: Best Stocks Of 2020 That You Should Own In 2021
text: It's that time of the year! A time to reflect on some the best performers of the past 12 months. Only a small percentage of stocks overperform the market dramatically over time, and chances are that the big winners of 2020 will remain relevant investments in 2021 and beyond.

title: U.S. crude inventories fall more than expected in latest week - EIA
text: Crude inventories fell by 6.1 million barrels in the week ended Dec. 25 to 493.5 million barrels, compared with analysts' expectations in a Reuters poll for a 2.6 million-barrel drop.

title: Expect a 'second wave' of pent up demand later in 2021, says Verdence Capital's Horneman
text: Megan Horneman, Verdence Capital Advisors director of portfolio strategy, and Kenny Polcari, Slatestone Wealth senior market strategist, join 'Squawk on the Street' to discuss where they see opportunities in 2021.
